column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Julia Kass wrote a book about a black attorney that I go to see in Selma , his name is JL Cheston Jr. He 's a character in my book A Writer 's Life .
#Text=Schools that used to be all white are now all black , so now there 's a reverse segregation .
#Text=Alabama it used to be kids could n't get into white schools .
#Text=Now there is white flight and they are all black .
#Text=That 's true of Selma , public schools in New York , too .
#Text=They are minority schools , now .
#Text=They are either black or hispanic .
#Text=DS : Do you think Joel Klein has improved it ?
#Text=GT :
#Text=Nope .
#Text=He might have improved the education because the mayor we have now is a very good mayor , and he chose Klein and he brings a certain articulation and wisdom to an egalitarian education .
#Text=But do we have it , really ?
#Text=Every public school teacher that 's in the system in this town is almost like a missionary .
#Text=They go off and risk life in the interest of humanism .
#Text=But the private schools , the disgusting sight of drivers picking up children , disgusting sight of limousine drivers lining up .
#Text=I 'm only a block away from one of them here .

#Text=All over this city at two and three o'clock , you find dark-skinned women waiting for their young , white blazer-clad private school boy and escorting him either into a car that has a driver or walking the kids to wherever their homes are in the neighborhood .
#Text=The public schools and private schools are two different worlds .
#Text=Just like our American military .

#Text=The people who do not have the resources , and therefore they become dependent on the largess of military life to support their income or because the military affords them opportunity -- so they think -- because the military provides a life better than the meaningless life they have in private life .
#Text=They get out of high school -- maybe , maybe not even that -- and what do they have to look forward to , these people ?
#Text=Particularly the men , the undereducated male .
#Text=A life of minimum wage in some shopping mall working for some fast food place or driving a truck .
#Text=State of Journalism
#Text=DS : What do you think about Murdoch buying The Wall Street Journal ?
#Text=GT :
#Text=It does n't bother me .
#Text=It 's not like the wonderful Bancroft family was some noble dynasty !
#Text=It 's not like we should lament the passing of some noble dynasty to the corrupt News Corp.
#Text=DS : It 's painted that way .
#Text=GT :
#Text=He 's better than they are ! It does n't bother me .
#Text=Journalism -I think there is some very good stuff .
#Text=There 's some wonderful writing as well as reporting in The New York Times every day .
#Text=It 's not on the front page , necessarily .
#Text=The sections I enjoy reading are The City section , stories about life in the city ; and the Real Estate section .
#Text=There 's stories about neighborhoods at night and neighborhoods at day .
#Text=If you are thinking about renting an apartment or moving into a neighborhood , the story says , " look at it at night .
